author: .vbuterin
content: The characteristics are basically that you can make an O(1) size witness for any arbitrary number of chunks

author: .vbuterin
content: And the main benefit of Merkle trees, the ability to quickly update witnesses when you quickly update the underlying data, does not really exist for contract code

author: .vbuterin
content: it would actually be interesting for code merklization to do dual-commitment: include both a Merkle root *and* a Kate commitment to the code in the account object

author: .vbuterin
content: that plus my gas cost change EIP ( https://notes.ethereum.org/@vbuterin/BkrNbeAfD ) would quickly get us to having acceptable stateless witness sizes
